intro: Salaxis benguelensis, commonly known as the Benguela salax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils, adapting well to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
